timeline.bodyText: What is dv? Please use a more descriptive name.
timeline.author: haykam821

replies.bodyText: I named it dv for consistency with the arguments (ARG 1 dx, ARG 2 dy and ARG 3 dz) of method_14661 offset (III)V. Is deltaVec or something like that better?
replies.author: enbrain

replies.bodyText:
I would name it vec3d for consistency with the corresponding method in Box:

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            		ARG 1 dv
          
          
            
            		ARG 1 vec3d
replies.author: haykam821

replies.bodyText:
Is it more important than the consistency with dx, dy and dz?
I don't think vec3d is descriptive because being vec3d is pretty obvious from the type information. It doesn't add any information to it.
On the other hand, delta gives you additional information, that is, the distance between the original box and the result box. (Even a letter d typically means delta or distance in math context.)
I'm still thinking what is the best name. (We might need to refactor other code later.)
replies.author: enbrain

replies.bodyText:
Those dx, dy, and dz names aren't right; they should just be x, y, and z. I think it's obvious in the context of the signature (BlockBox.offset(Lnet/minecraft/util/math/Vec3i;)V) that we're offsetting the BlockBox by a Vec3i and the name should reflect that. Specifying 'delta' is redundant and shortening it to 'd' simply makes it more confusing.
Also, just noticed, this actually takes in a Vec3i:

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            		ARG 1 dv
          
          
            
            		ARG 1 vec3i
replies.author: haykam821

replies.bodyText:
This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters

replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: I will keep the argument unmapped for now.
replies.author: enbrain

replies.bodyText: what makes delta so bad? maybe offset if you want to name like builders
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: It should be named like Box.offset(III) is, and BlockBox.offset(III) should as well.
replies.author: haykam821

replies.bodyText: just delta. dx dy etc have their d stand for "delta", so delta is the fitting name.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: dx, dy, and dz should just be x, y, and z as well. It's much less redundant to say, 'I am offsetting this BlockBox by a Vec3i', rather than, 'I am offsetting this BlockBox by the delta Vec3i'.
replies.author: haykam821

replies.bodyText: Would worth a debate in a separate issue.
replies.author: liach
